body.p: The map and game settings page allows you to edit settings related to what objects can spawn on the map, and how powerups work.
The fields available to edit are as follows:

dl.dd: Controls whether vehicles can be destroyed.
Controls which types of vehicles can spawn on the map. Spawn points for ineligible vehicles may be altered to produce an eligible vehicle, or may produce nothing, depending on the chosen vehicle set.

body.p: Firefight files contain the same set of Custom Game options as normal Multiplayer game variants, but not all of these options are functional. By default, ReachVariantTool will hide or grey out Firefight settings that are known to be non-functional. Those settings include:

dl.dd: Controls whether grenades can spawn on the map. This probably would work if any Firefight maps had pre-placed grenades.
Controls whether Armor Ability pickups can spawn on the map. This probably would work if any Firefight maps had pre-placed Armor Ability pickups.
Controls whether powerups can spawn on the map. This probably would work if any Firefight maps had pre-placed powerups.
Controls whether turrets can spawn on the map.
Controls which types of weapons can spawn on the map. This probably would work if any Firefight maps had pre-placed weapons.
Controls how long the player has Red Powerup Traits after picking up an Overshield powerup. Since powerups don't appear on Firefight maps, this setting is unused here.
Controls how long the player has Blue Powerup Traits after picking up an Active Camo powerup. Since powerups don't appear on Firefight maps, this setting is unused here.
Controls how long the player has Yellow Powerup Traits after picking up a Custom Powerup. Since powerups don't appear on Firefight maps, this setting is unused here.
